text: On tap at Birratrovo. Great refreshing and aromatic light drink, balanced aromatic hops, pink grapefruit, sweet red citruses

Draught @ Mother Kellys, 251 Paradise Row, Bethnal Green, Greater London, England E2 9LE. [ As Left Handed Giant Pale ].Light unclear medium orange yellow color with a small to average, frothy, good to fair lacing, mostly lasting to diminishing, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, fruity malt, moderate hoppy, fruity hops, citrus. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a average duration, pale malt, fruity malt, fruity hops, citrus. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20161125]
 7-3-7-3-14

Cask, 1/2 pint, hand-pulled at State Bar, Glasgow on 12 Dec 2016, lovely pine, citrus, tropical fruits aroma, golden with a white head and sporadic lacing, lovely hoppy ale with a good creamy malty balance, sweet, smooth.

On cask at the Hanging Bat. 
Appearance - golden with a decent head. 
Nose - orange sweets and barley.
Taste - more orange barley sweets. 
Palate - close to medium bodied with a creamy texture and a long dry finish. 
Overall - good beer.
Cask @ Tamworth beer festival, pale amber with white head and a citrus, hoppy taste loaded with tropical fruit leaving a fruity hoppy citrusy aftertaste, nice.
Pours slightly hazy gold. Light grapefruit and mango aroma, slight hint of bready malt. Cut grass, grapefruit and pine flavour with clean dry finish and med bitterness. light bodied
On tap oro velatabuonaschiuma piuttosto fruttata agrumato secca fresca buona beva
Cask in the Grain Barge, Bristol. Blond with some white suds. Light grapefruit aroma. The taste has some nice tropical flavour, but is ultimately a little thin. Grapefruit notes and a bitter finish.
Pint at the Split Chimp Newcastle: Hazy gold body, with a thin white skim. Grassy aroma, sweet citrus and straw flavours. Light bodied, sharp and refreshing. Superior quaffer.

Tap @Barley Mow, Bristol.
Appearance: medium head, gold colour, hazy, nice lacing.
Aroma: sweet citrusy, grapefruit, orange.
Taste: lightly sweet with strong botter aftertaste.
Palate: light body, long finish, soft carbonation.
Good, refreshing, nicely balanced.
On keg in Trembling Madness, York..Served golden and clear with a moderate head. Good citrus taste with hints of grapefruit, mango, and lemon. Spicy bitter finish.
Cask. Hazy yellow with creamy white head. Straw, lemon, malty aroma. Malt sweet flavour with smoothy bitterness

Cask at Jack in the Box, Altrincham. Hazy golden/light amber. Decent lacing. Grassy hop notes and light sticky tropical fruits on the tongue. Dry and medium bitter. Seems interesting enough but the whole thing doesnt seem to coalesce perfectly.

(keg) hazy golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of herbal hops and pale malts, very resinous, with a touch of mango juice and carrots. flavour is mostly orange peel and herbal hops, again rather resinous, with some notes of yeast and a semi-dry finish. medium-bodied with average carbonation.

Cask at small bar, Bristol. Aroma is really nice peachy and mango citrus tropical hop. . translucent golden orange coloured pour with a thin lastkng whirs head. Flavour is composed of crisp dryalts, nutty, mango And peach pretty tasty
On tap at Small Bar UK. Poured light hazy orange thick white head. Aroma juicy lemon citrus. Light carb med bod. Tastes bitter grassy hay dank.

Keg at the Fox. It pours hazy golden-yellow with a small white head. The nose is soft, juicy, apricot, mango, juicy tangerine, candied peel and brioche. The taste is crisp, juicy, minerals, orange, apricot, grapefruit, sherbet and pepper with a bone-dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Foamy action. Crisp and crushable. Very nice.

Keg at the Fox E8 - London. Pours lightly hazed yellow-gold with a creamy, white head. The aroma holds pithy citrus, lemon, straw, pale malts. Light sweet flavorbwith biscuity pale malts, pithy lemon, some rind, more straw. Light bodied with average carbonation. Decent balance on the finish with crispy pale malts, pith, hay, straw. Pretty basic but certainly quaffable.

Moderate body, light carbonation, fruity, nettle bitterness, Grapefruit, pithy finish.

Cask conditioned at The Victoria, Clifden, Bristol. Hazy gold with white head. This is a fresh, hoppy, bitter beer, plenty of citrus, grapefruit pith flavours, there is a light, biscuity, malty body. A really decent beer.
Cask at the Bull & Last. Hazy pale golden, thin white foam. Crisp malts. Zesty sherbety hop feel, lemon and grapefruit, mild cat. Medium bitterness, quite dry. Pretty decent.

Keg from The Beerhive. Hazy pale golden body with a thin white head. Steady carbonation. Light lacing. Aroma of lemon, melon and grapefruit. Flavour of lemon sponge, mandarin and orange. Medium body with an oily texture. Soft fizz. Very fruity. Nice.

Cask-conditioned at the Small Bar, Bristol 28/2/2015. Golden with a tight, white, head. Easy drinking pale ale, with a touch of stone fruit, grassy hops, crisp cereal malts and moderately bitter finish.
Cask at the hanging bat... Light white lacing... Soft fruits.. Zezty lemon nose.. Dry fruits.. Zezty lime.. Juicy fruits... Big zezty hoppy front... Orange and pineapple
Cask at the hanging bat. Pours hazy gold, thick white head. Aromas are grassy, light citrus. Taste is bitter, more hay notes. Bitter finish.
Cask at the hanging bat. Pours hazy pale amber, nose is fruity pineapple, toffee, taste is similar, dry.
